content.description: Sit start on a pair of crimps. Work up the face making interesting moves on sidepulls and gastons.
content.location: About 80 feet down the trail from Turtle Traverse. Flat, chalked, vertical, and facing the trail.

content.description: Start matched on the right-facing scoop jug and head up.
content.location: Near the left corner of the trail-facing side of the far clump of Front Range boulders.

content.description:
This problem might not be much to look at, but it's actually quite fun.  Very hard V6 in my opinion.  It takes some effort to work the beta out, there's some funky moves on this one. 

  Start matched on the big black sloper on the left side of the boulder.  Move into the obvious sidepull to the right, avoiding the holds on the lip.  Use some combination of brute strength and technique to keep moving right, and make a big move out right to a sloper on the lip.  Top out when you can.
content.protection: You don't really even need a crashpad, since it's like four feet off the ground.
content.location: After forking right on the trail, look out to the left for a large boulder that looks like a turtle.

content.description: Climb through the cool looking zig zag crack system
content.location: Crack to the left of Jump Start Thing

content.description: Climb the slab using the black crystal
content.location: To the right of Extra Cheese

content.description: Dyno to the lip followed by a mantle for the finish
content.location: The first boulder you reach at the Front Range

content.description: Climb subtle edges and crystals up the face.
content.protection: A pad or two and a spotter
content.location: Next line to the right of Knob Job.

content.description:
Sit start on low end of arete with right heel hook. Work your way left up the arete. Crux has two parts: first moving to the large outcrop approximately half way along the route, second part is turning the outcrop to a mantle move.  

  I first climbed this in November 2014. It isn't listed in Sandstone Warrior (Matt Bliss) but may or may not be the FA.
content.protection: Low to the ground. Standard bouldering pad and a second to slide it along as you move up to the left.
content.location: Front Range, in front of the Ananconda Boulder. If you are facing Vector Days the climb is behind you to the right.

content.description: Nice crack with a variety of jams available.
content.location: Trailside face of the second clump of Front Range boulders

content.description: Climb through the tall flaring crack to the left of the dihedral
content.location: To the right of The Lightning Cracks

content.description: Start on Bigfoot, traverse the crack left.
content.location: On the right trailside face of the Vector Days boulder.

content.description: Start on jugs in the horizontal crack. Go up the arete to the right.
content.location: Towards the back of the Vector Days boulder.

content.description: Cluster of boulders right off the trail, with some good slabs, cracks and traverses, from V1-V6.  This is one of the closest areas to the parking lot.
